SEARCH
Package org.myshelfie.network.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
org.myshelfie.network.server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Remote, ServerRMIInterface
public class Server extends UnicastRemoteObject implements ServerRMIInterface
Server class. It handles the communication with the clients and the game logic. There should be only one instance of this class, even with multiple games.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server() throws RemoteException
      Main Server constructor. It sets the default logging level to INFO.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - In case it is not possible to initialize the RMI server

    • Server

      public Server(Level loggingLevel) throws RemoteException
      Server constructor with logging level parameter
      Parameters:
      loggingLevel - the logging level to set
      Throws:
      RemoteException - In case it is not possible to initialize the RMI server

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main class to start the server. Usage example: java -jar server.jar [--server-address=&lt;server-address&gt;] [--backup] [--logging=&lt;debug|info|error&gt;]
      • --server-address: The IP address of the interface to publish the RMI server on
      • --backup: If present, the server will try to resume from a backup file (serverBackup.ser)
      • --logging: The logging level to set (debug, info, error)
      Parameters:
      args - An array of CLI arguments

    • getClient

      public Client getClient(String nickname)
      Get the registered client that has the given nickname
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client to get
      Returns:
      the client with the given nickname, or null if there is no client with that nickname

    • register

      public void register(Client client) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Register a client to the server. The client has to have a nickname that is not already taken. Registering a client will allow for the client to receive updates from the server and vice-versa.
      Parameters:
      client - the client to register
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is already a client with the same nickname

    • unregister

      public void unregister(Client client)
      Unregister a client from the server. This will make it impossible for the client to send updates to the server.
      Parameters:
      client - the client to unregister

    • update

      public void update(ClientRMIInterface clientRMIInterface, CommandMessageWrapper msg) throws RemoteException
      Update of the server after a client send a message. This method forwards the message produced by the View (which is observed by the client) to the controller, specifying the client that generated the event.
      Specified by:
      update in interface ServerRMIInterface
      Parameters:
      clientRMIInterface - the client that generated the event
      msg - wrapped message received from the client
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • updatePreGame

      public Object updatePreGame(ClientRMIInterface clientRMIInterface, CommandMessageWrapper msg) throws RemoteException
      Update of the server after a client send a message, before the game begins (pre-game phase). In this phase, the controller logic is handled differently, since the game has not started yet.
      Specified by:
      updatePreGame in interface ServerRMIInterface
      Parameters:
      clientRMIInterface - the client that generated the event
      msg - wrapped message received from the client
      Returns:
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • startServer

      public void startServer(Object lock)
      Start the server, both RMI and socket
      Parameters:
      lock - A lock that will be notified when the socket server is ready to accept connections

    • startRMIServer

      public void startRMIServer() throws RemoteException
      Start the RMI server, binding the server object to the registry.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the registry cannot be created or the binding fails

    • startSocketServer

      public void startSocketServer(Object lock)
      Start the socket server.
      Parameters:
      lock - the lock to notify when the server is started

    • stopSocketServer

      public void stopSocketServer()
      Stop the socket server, not listening for connections anymore.

    • stopRMIServer

      public void stopRMIServer()
      Stop the RMI server.

    • stopServer

      public void stopServer()
      Stop the server (both RMI and socket).

    • sendTo

      public void sendTo(Socket clientSocket, Serializable message)
      Send a message to a client over a socket connection.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - the socket to send the message to. Can be obtained with Client.getClientSocket()
      message - the message to send the client

    • heartbeat

      public void heartbeat(ClientRMIInterface client, HeartBeatMessage msg) throws RemoteException
      Handle the heartbeat message sent by a client, updating the last heartbeat timestamp.
      Specified by:
      heartbeat in interface ServerRMIInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The client (RMIInterface) that sent the heartbeat
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If the client is not registered

    • getGames

      public List<GameController.GameDefinition> getGames() throws RemoteException
      Returns a list of the games currently available on the server (to be shown in the lobby).
      Returns:
      A list of the games currently available on the server
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • createGame

      public boolean createGame(CreateGameMessage message) throws RemoteException
      Create a new game with the given settings
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface ServerRMIInterface
      Parameters:
      message - Message containing the game settings and the client information
      Returns:
      True if the game was created successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if it's impossible to create the game

    • joinGame

      public boolean joinGame(JoinGameMessage message) throws RemoteException
      Make a client join an existing game
      Specified by:
      joinGame in interface ServerRMIInterface
      Parameters:
      message - Message containing the game identifier and the client information
      Returns:
      True if the client joined the game successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the game is already full or if the game doesn't exist

    • shouldResumeFromBackup

      public boolean shouldResumeFromBackup()
      Returns whether the --backup command line option was set, i.e., whether the server should try to resume its status from the backup file.
      Returns:
      True if the server should resume from backup, false otherwise

    • log

      public void log(Level logLevel, String message)
      Log a message. This will be forwarded to the logger, which will log the message to the console and to the log file.
      Parameters:
      logLevel - The log level (FINE, INFO, WARNING, SEVERE, ...)
      message - The message to log
